column4: iirc there's a fairly experimental USB QoS option in the kernel configuration
not sure where you can get the user-space tools from (if it's even turned on in the ubuntu kernels)
it wouldn't be unusual for it to be using a USB bus (look in BIOS)
the .xsession-errors log says /etc/gdm/Xsession: Beginning session setup...
I guess it's that mkdtemp failing that's the problem.  what runs that?
what's an RFE?
Request for Enhancement
oh, I see.
I once had breezy delete itself when I booted due to /tmp having a 'bind mount' in it.
I think a little /tmp-sanity-checking would be a good thing.
erk :/ that's a little crazy - yeah, probably best to assimilate it from another distro too
I had the whole of / bound to a mountpoint /tmp/root
man :/ that's a nasty malfunction
example I just ran in to, seen it all over in the 'SEE ALSO' sections though
such as?
debconf, dpkg-reconfigure reference debconf(7)
/usr/share/man/man7/debconf.7.gz is in package debconf-doc
the man pages are often not required by the packages they document.  don't know why.
thanks - I guess this can't be helped
well, it could be - the package could depend upon its documentation package...
discover "apt-file" - it's useful for finding man pages and other files.
true, but it's so obvious, there has to be a good reason why it doesn't :/
I did "apt-file search debconf | grep 7" to find that
cheers, I'll remember that one
